header: CNR No.MHPU01­000196­2019 Roshan Dattatray Pisal Vs. State of Maharashtra (Hadapsar Police Station )

background.text: Order below exh. 1 in Cri. Bail application No.59/2019 1. This is an application U/s.439 of Cr.P.C. filed by the applicant­accused for grant of bail in connection with Crime No.810/2018, registered with Hadapsar Police Station for the offence punishable u/s.399, 402 of IPC, u/s.4(25) of the Arms Act and u/s. 37(1) 135 of the B. P.Act.

arguments.text: 2. Prosecution case is that on 11/07/2018 at about 02­30 a.m., applicant/accused were found in front of Draksh Saushodhan Kendre, Pune­Solapur road, Hadapsar, Pune along with sickle, knife, chilli power and motorcycles and thereby were making plan to commit dacoity.

argumentSentences.text: Prosecution case is that on 11/07/2018 at about 02­30 a.m., applicant/accused were found in front of Draksh Saushodhan Kendre, Pune­Solapur road, Hadapsar, Pune along with sickle, knife, chilli power and motorcycles and thereby were making plan to commit dacoity.

arguments.text: 3. Learned advocate for applicant/accused submitted that applicant/accused have not committed any offence and he has not in any way concerned with the crime. She further submitted that merely because some cases are pending against him, police have arrested to applicant/accused. She further submitted that co­accused are already released on bail. She further submitted that custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary, therefore, he be released on bail.

argumentSentences.text: Learned advocate for applicant/accused submitted that applicant/accused have not committed any offence and he has not in any way concerned with the crime.
She further submitted that merely because some cases are pending against him, police have arrested to applicant/accused.
She further submitted that co­accused are already released on bail.
She further submitted that custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary, therefore, he be released on bail.

arguments.text: 4. On the other hand, learned APP submitted that on 11/07/2018 at about 02­30 a.m., applicants/accused were found in front of Draksh Saushodhan Kendre, Pune­Solapur road, Hadapsar, Pune along with sickle, knife, chilli power and motorcycles and thereby were making plan to commit dacoity. He further submitted that applicant/accused is habitual offender. He has committed similar kind of offence, and if he is released on bail, there is every possibility of tampering the prosecution evidence.

argumentSentences.text: On the other hand, learned APP submitted that on 11/07/2018 at about 02­30 a.m., applicants/accused were found in front of Draksh Saushodhan Kendre, Pune­Solapur road, Hadapsar, Pune along with sickle, knife, chilli power and motorcycles and thereby were making plan to commit dacoity.
He further submitted that applicant/accused is habitual offender.
He has committed similar kind of offence, and if he is released on bail, there is every possibility of tampering the prosecution evidence.

arguments.text: 5. On perusing police papers, it reveals that on 11/07/2018, PSI Shri. Mangesh Bhange along with other police staff was on patrolling duty in front of Draksh Saushodhan Kendre, Pune­Solapur road, Hadapsar, Pune, they found applicants/accused along with accused gathered and making preparation to commit dacoity and they were found with deadly weapons etc. Moreover, as per prosecution case, when police carried impugned raid, the applicant/accused fled away form the spot of incident, and thereafter police arrested him on 17/12/2018. Moreover, it seems that Investigating officer has already seized two sickles, knife, chilly powder and two motorcycles. It appears that custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary. Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­accused is released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution. Hence, I pass the following order .

argumentSentences.text: On perusing police papers, it reveals that on 11/07/2018, PSI Shri.

Mangesh Bhange along with other police staff was on patrolling duty in front of Draksh Saushodhan Kendre, Pune­Solapur road, Hadapsar, Pune, they found applicants/accused along with accused gathered and making preparation to commit dacoity and they were found with deadly weapons etc.
Moreover, as per prosecution case, when police carried impugned raid, the applicant/accused fled away form the spot of incident, and thereafter police arrested him on 17/12/2018.
Moreover, it seems that Investigating officer has already seized two sickles, knife, chilly powder and two motorcycles.
It appears that custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary.
Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­accused is released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution.
Hence, I pass the following order .

order.text: ORDER 1. Application is allowed. 2. The applicant­accused­Roshan Dattatray Pisal be released on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty five Thousand Only) with one or two solvent separate sureties in like amount. 3. The applicant­accused shall not tamper with prosecution evidence. 4. The applicant­accused shall attend concerned Police Station on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­sheet. 5. The applicant­accused shall not leave Pune District without prior permission of this Court, till final disposal of the case. 6. The applicant­accused shall furnish fresh residential address to concerned Police Station and to this Court in case he changed present address. 7. The applicant­accused shall attend the court regularly till final disposal of the case.

footer: Date : 09/01/2019 (K.D.Vadane) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. 4 “I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Order are same word to word as per original judgment.” Name of Steno : Shri S. B. processedText:
CNR No.MHPU01­000196­2019 Roshan Dattatray Pisal Vs. State of Maharashtra (Hadapsar Police Station ) 
---header-ends---
Order below exh. 1 in Cri. Bail application No.59/2019 1. This is an application U/s.439 of Cr.P.C. filed by the applicant­accused for grant of bail in connection with Crime No.810/2018, registered with Hadapsar Police Station for the offence punishable u/s.399, 402 of IPC, u/s.4(25) of the Arms Act and u/s. 37(1) 135 of the B. P.Act. 
---background-ends---
2. Prosecution case is that on 11/07/2018 at about 02­30 a.m., applicant/accused were found in front of Draksh Saushodhan Kendre, Pune­Solapur road, Hadapsar, Pune along with sickle, knife, chilli power and motorcycles and thereby were making plan to commit dacoity. 
---argument-ends---
3. Learned advocate for applicant/accused submitted that applicant/accused have not committed any offence and he has not in any way concerned with the crime. She further submitted that merely because some cases are pending against him, police have arrested to applicant/accused. She further submitted that co­accused are already released on bail. She further submitted that custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary, therefore, he be released on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4. On the other hand, learned APP submitted that on 11/07/2018 at about 02­30 a.m., applicants/accused were found in front of Draksh Saushodhan Kendre, Pune­Solapur road, Hadapsar, Pune along with sickle, knife, chilli power and motorcycles and thereby were making plan to commit dacoity. He further submitted that applicant/accused is habitual offender. He has committed similar kind of offence, and if he is released on bail, there is every possibility of tampering the prosecution evidence. 
---argument-ends---
5. On perusing police papers, it reveals that on 11/07/2018, PSI Shri. Mangesh Bhange along with other police staff was on patrolling duty in front of Draksh Saushodhan Kendre, Pune­Solapur road, Hadapsar, Pune, they found applicants/accused along with accused gathered and making preparation to commit dacoity and they were found with deadly weapons etc. Moreover, as per prosecution case, when police carried impugned raid, the applicant/accused fled away form the spot of incident, and thereafter police arrested him on 17/12/2018. Moreover, it seems that Investigating officer has already seized two sickles, knife, chilly powder and two motorcycles. It appears that custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary. Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­accused is released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution. Hence, I pass the following order . 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1. Application is allowed. 2. The applicant­accused­Roshan Dattatray Pisal be released on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty five Thousand Only) with one or two solvent separate sureties in like amount. 3. The applicant­accused shall not tamper with prosecution evidence. 4. The applicant­accused shall attend concerned Police Station on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­sheet. 5. The applicant­accused shall not leave Pune District without prior permission of this Court, till final disposal of the case. 6. The applicant­accused shall furnish fresh residential address to concerned Police Station and to this Court in case he changed present address. 7. The applicant­accused shall attend the court regularly till final disposal of the case. 
---order-ends---
Date : 09/01/2019 (K.D.Vadane) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. 4 “I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Order are same word to word as per original judgment.” Name of Steno : Shri S. B. Gore, Stenographer Grade­I Court Name : K.D. Vadane , Addl. Sessions Judge, Pune Date : 09/01/2019 Order signed by presiding officer on : 09/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 09/01/2019
